New Records: David Warner joined Ross Taylor and Virat Kohli as the only players to have reached 100 internationals in each format.
Key Match Events: David Warner smashed a half-century in his 100th T20I before leg-spinner Adam Zampa starred with three wickets as Australia held off a barnstorming chase from a full-strength West Indies.
Warner cracked 70 off 36 deliveries and Tim David hit a 17-ball 37.
Brandon King and Johnson Charles smashed a half-century partnership inside four overs.
Zampa bowled superbly in the middle-overs to outfox an ultra-aggressive West Indies.
West Indies' seamers took the pace off in the backend with slower balls accounting for several wickets.
West Indies' big-hitters continued to go the aerial route, but fell away despite a late onslaught from Jason Holder.
Zampa produced a brilliant 16th over to claim the wickets of Andre Russell and Nicholas Pooran which closed the door on West Indies.
Pre-Game Insights: The three-match series effectively starts T20 World Cup preparations for both teams with game two to be played in Adelaide on Sunday.
Warner is essentially a lock for the T20 World Cup, which will be his international cricket swansong.
The race is on to find Warner's opening partner with Josh Inglis getting first crack having impressed at the top of the order in the ODI series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: West Indies' strategy of relying on slower deliveries seems fraught with danger on harder Australian pitches, but appears a blueprint for the expected slower surfaces at their home World Cup.
Australia's frontline pace attack is obviously settled, but intrigue surrounds which other quicks will be selected for the World Cup.
Windy conditions made it difficult for Jason Behrendorff to generate his trademark swing and he was whacked for 16 runs in the first over.
